intro: Calamagrostis neglecta f. exserta, commonly known as the silver feather reedgrass, is a ornamental grass native to North America. It features slender, arching blades that are gray-green in color, giving it a distinctive silvery appearance. The plant produces feathery, plume-like inflorescences that add visual interest in the fall. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers moist, well-drained soil. This cultivar is prized for its elegant form and low maintenance requirements in garden settings.
